applications.name: Google Slides
applications.description: Google Slides is a cloud-based presentation application for creating, editing, and presenting slideshows with real-time collaboration. It includes accessibility features like screen reader support, keyboard navigation, and alt text for images.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Forward Slash together to open searchable keyboard shortcuts reference dialog.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce shortcuts dialog opened. Search or browse all available shortcuts.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt and Forward Slash together to search all menu commands in Google Slides.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce search box. Type command name for quick access to menu items.

shortcuts.description: Press Page Down to navigate to the next slide in the presentation.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce next slide number and title if present.

shortcuts.description: Press Page Up to navigate to the previous slide in the presentation.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce previous slide number and title.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Home together to jump to the first slide in the presentation.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce slide one and read slide title.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and End together to jump to the last slide in the presentation.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce final slide number and title.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, Shift, and F together to move focus to the slide filmstrip panel.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce filmstrip focused. Navigate slides with arrow keys.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, Shift, and C together to move focus to the slide canvas editing area.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce canvas focused. Navigate objects with Tab.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and M together to insert a new slide after the current slide with same layout.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce new slide created and slide number. Focus moves to new slide.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and D together to create a duplicate copy of the selected slide.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce slide duplicated. Copy appears after original with all content.

shortcuts.context: When slide is selected in filmstrip
shortcuts.description: Press Delete to remove the selected slide from the presentation.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce slide deleted. Focus moves to next slide.

shortcuts.context: When slide is selected in filmstrip
shortcuts.description: Press Control and Up Arrow together to move selected slide up one position in the presentation.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce slide repositioned.

shortcuts.context: When slide is selected in filmstrip
shortcuts.description: Press Control and Down Arrow together to move selected slide down one position.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce slide moved down.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Up Arrow together to move selected slide to first position.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce slide moved to beginning.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Down Arrow together to move selected slide to last position.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce slide moved to end of presentation.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and B together to make selected text bold or toggle bold off.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce bold formatting applied depending on verbosity settings.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and I together to italicize selected text or toggle italic off.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce italic formatting based on settings.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and U together to underline selected text or remove underline.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce underline formatting.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt, Shift, and 5 together to apply strikethrough formatting to selected text.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce strikethrough applied.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Greater Than together to increase font size to next available size.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce new font size.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Less Than together to decrease font size to next smaller size.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce reduced font size.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and L together to left align text in the text box.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce left alignment when checking text formatting.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and E together to center align text in the text box.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce center alignment applied.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and R together to right align text in the text box.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce right alignment in text formatting.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and J together to justify text in the text box.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce justified alignment.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Backslash together to remove all formatting from selected text.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce formatting cleared. Returns text to default style.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and 8 together to create a bulleted list from selected text.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce bulleted list created.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and 7 together to create a numbered list from selected text.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce numbered list created with sequential numbering.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then I then T to insert a text box on the current slide.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce text box mode active. Click to place or drag to size text box.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt then I then I to open image insertion dialog for adding images to slide.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce image dialog. Choose from upload, URL, Drive, or search.

shortcuts.context: When text or object is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Control and K together to insert or edit a hyperlink on selected text or object.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce link dialog opened. Enter URL and press Enter to apply.

shortcuts.context: When object is selected on slide
shortcuts.description: Press Control and D together to create a duplicate copy of the selected object.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce object duplicated. Copy appears slightly offset from original.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and G together to group selected objects so they move and resize together.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce objects grouped. Can manipulate as single unit.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, Shift, and G together to ungroup objects for individual editing.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce objects ungrouped.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Up Arrow together to bring selected object to front of all overlapping objects.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers typically don't announce layer changes. Visual positioning only.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Down Arrow together to send selected object behind all overlapping objects.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers don't announce layer order changes.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Up Arrow together to bring object forward one layer in stacking order.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers don't announce layer changes.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Down Arrow together to send object backward one layer in stacking order.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers don't announce layer order.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and F5 together to start presenting from the first slide in full screen mode.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce presentation starting. Limited screen reader functionality during presentation mode.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and F5 together to start presenting from the currently selected slide.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce presentation starting from current position.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, Shift, and P together to start presentation with speaker notes visible.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce presenter view. Notes visible only to presenter.

variants.keys: Right Arrow or Space or N
Right Arrow or Space or N

shortcuts.description: Press Right Arrow, Space, or N to advance to next slide or animation during presentation.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may have limited announcements during presentation mode.

shortcuts.description: Press Left Arrow or P to go back to previous slide during presentation.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may not announce slide changes during presentation.

shortcuts.description: Type a slide number then press Enter to jump directly to that slide during presentation.
shortcuts.notes: Type number then Enter. Screen readers may not announce navigation.

shortcuts.description: Press Escape to exit presentation mode and return to editing view.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce presentation ended and return to editor.

shortcuts.description: Press F11 to toggle between fullscreen and windowed presentation mode.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce fullscreen mode toggled.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Z together to undo the last action or change made to the presentation.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce what was undone depending on verbosity.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Y together to redo an action that was previously undone.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce redo action completion.

shortcuts.context: When object or text is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Control and C together to copy selected object or text to clipboard.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce copied to clipboard.

shortcuts.context: When object or text is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Control and X together to cut selected object or text and place on clipboard.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce cut to clipboard.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and V together to paste clipboard content onto current slide.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce paste occurred.

shortcuts.context: On slide canvas or in text
shortcuts.description: Press Control and A together to select all objects on slide or all text in text box.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce all content selected.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and H together to open Find and Replace dialog for searching and replacing text.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce dialog with find and replace fields.

shortcuts.context: When object or text is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and M together to add a comment on selected object or text.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce comment box opened. Type comment and press Ctrl+Enter to post.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, Shift, and S together to open speaker notes panel for adding presentation notes.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce speaker notes panel opened. Notes visible only during presenting with notes view.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and Z together to enable screen reader optimized mode for Google Slides.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce screen reader support enabled. Improves object navigation and announcements.

shortcuts.context: When image or object is selected
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Alt, and Y together to open alt text dialog for adding description to images and objects.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce alt text dialog. Add descriptions for accessibility. Essential for screen reader users.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and O together to open file picker for selecting a presentation from Google Drive.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce file picker dialog. Navigate files with arrow keys.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and P together to open print dialog for printing slides or saving as PDF.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce print dialog. Configure layout and print options.
